# UIDictationPhrase

**Class**

An object that represents the textual interpretation of a spoken phrase that the user dictates.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIDictationPhrase
```

## Overview

When the user chooses dictation input on a supported device, the system automatically inserts recognized phrases into the current text view. You can use an object of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDictationPhrase] class to obtain a string representing a phrase a user has dictated. In the case of ambiguous dictation results, a dictation phrase object provides an array containing alternative strings. Methods in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextInput] protocol allow your app to respond to the completion of dictation.

## Obtaining textual interpretations of spoken text

- **alternativeInterpretations**: An array of alternative textual interpretations of a dictated phrase.
- **text**: The most likely textual interpretation of a dictated phrase.

## Text input

- **UITextInput**: A set of methods for interacting with the text input system and enabling features in documents.
- **UITextInputDelegate**: An intermediary between a document and the text input system.
- **UIKeyInput**: A set of methods a responder uses to implement simple text entry.
- **UITextInputTraits**: A set of methods that defines features for keyboard input to a text object.
- **UITextInputContext**: An object that reports the type of input your app receives.
- **UITextInputMode**: The current text input mode.
- **UITextInputAssistantItem**: An object that manages custom bar button items that you add to the shortcuts bar above the keyboard on iPad.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
